description: This course introduces students to different topics within the cultures and traditions of the
familiarity with significant moments, movements, voices, and trends in society, politics,
architecture, and literature, and their interdependence. The course also acquaints students with
intellectual debates and conflicts in and about the Middle East, and enables them to better think
through those debates for themselves. Counts toward Middle East studies concentration.  Can be
taken more than once, insofar as topics change.
fullname: Topics in Modern Middle Eastern Studies
shortname: Topics in Modern Mid East Studies
